title: Barcelona To Move For £60 Million Rated Premier League Star
text:
Barcelona To Move For £60 Million Rated Premier League Star Wed Feb 22 2017 22:00:00   22:00:00 GMT+0000 (GMT) Ryan Sidle Ryan Sidle in football 
There was a time, not that long ago, that you'd have found it difficult to argue the case that a player could strengthen Barcelona. Now the La Liga champs are in need of reinforcements everywhere. 
Last weeks hammering at the hands of PSG told the story of Barcelona's current season. They may still be second in the league but they are clearly a long way from where they used to be. 
Luis Enrique's side struggled massively in the Champions League as the French champions battered them 4-0 in the city of love. 
Barca clearly need reinforcements in midfield but they were worryingly disappointing in defence and their lack of a right-back, despite Sergi Roberto's best efforts, is particularly in need of sorting. 
And according to the Evening Standard Tottenham Hotspur's Kyle Walker tops the shortlist of right backs but the Camp Nou side could have to pay upwards of £60 million. 
Reportedly last summer Manchester City made a bid of £60 million for Walker and his fellow full-back Danny Rose but Spurs told the former Premier League champions that each player was worth that much. 
Barca though could be willing to splash that cash as Walker would make the ideal replacement for Dani Alves who left for Juventus at the end of last season and is yet to be replaced.

It might be difficult to prise any player away from White Hart Lane right now with the club flying high and the prospect of a new ground in the 2018/19 season. 
However things are so close in the top four that they could easily have no Champions League football next season which would lead to questions over some players' futures. 
£60 million is a lot for a full back!
